question: Is the capability required for unique, mission or safety-critical functionality?
Does the capability encompass a unique program protection strategy or crypto technique?
Does the capability have classified data processing requirement?
Is the capability utilize proprietary or intellectual property design elements such as interfaces data types or communication buses?
Can the candidate capability be designed using non-proprietary reference models and architectural frameworks?
Can a non-proprietary architectural description language be used to define candidate capability modules and interfaces
Can key interfaces be determined for the candidate capability?
Does the capability produce any data?
Does the capability consume any data?
Does the capability store any data?
Do open standards exist that can be applied to the key interfaces of the candidate capability?
Is the amount of candidate capability redesign required to apply open standards to key interfaces acceptable?
Does applying open standard to key interfaces increase ease of integration into the technical baseline?
Does the capability consume any data?
Are V&V processes readily available to determine the candidate capability's compliance with the identified open system standards?
Can V&V test resources (lab and tools) be identified to exercise open standard conformance of the candidate capability at the appropriate classification level?
If the candidate is transitioned to open architecture, can system integration and integration and performance testing be conducted at appropriate classification level?
